data.Question: What data do you collect about clients (personal data, banking data, etc.)?
data.Commentaire: None

data.Question: Where is this data stored? Does it remain on production platforms?
data.Commentaire: Data stored in France, backed up data, encrypted and sent to a backup environment always in France

data.Question: Do you make any other use of this data (in addition to service provision)?
data.Commentaire: No

data.Question: How long is this data retained?
data.Commentaire: Contract duration + 60 days max, time to delete them (30 days max) and for backups to be automatically overwritten by new ones

data.Question: Do you transfer our data internally to other components of your information system? If yes, for what use and by what means?
data.Commentaire: Yes to backup environments (see above)

data.Question: Is all our data erased at the end of the contract?
data.Commentaire: Yes

data.Question: Is sensitive data encrypted at rest and in transit? With which algorithms? Can you specify which data is concerned if only a subset is encrypted?
data.Commentaire:
Encrypted in transit with TLS 1.3
Each file uploaded to the platform (considered the most sensitive data type) is additionally encrypted at rest with a dedicated key per client using RSA 4096 algorithm.
Partitions containing DBs are encrypted with LUKS

data.Question: How do you manage encryption keys?
data.Commentaire: Stored in an internal vault accessible only to the devops engineer and as backup, to the technical lead. Dedicated keys do not undergo rotation and partition encryption keys are unique for each instance (1 for each shared offering and 1 for each dedicated offering)

data.Question: What measures have you implemented to ensure client data integrity?
data.Commentaire: Periodic backup restoration tests (every quarter)

data.Question: What is your SLA in terms of service availability (monthly)?
data.Commentaire: We guarantee 99% availability over 12 rolling months

data.Question: What is your guaranteed response time in case of incident?
data.Commentaire: 8h, incident handling and first notification within 8h

data.Question: What is your guaranteed repair time for failures in case of incident?
data.Commentaire: We have an 8h RTO

data.Question: Can you provide historical data on your service availability?
data.Commentaire:
If we relate the 99% commitment to a month, a 39-minute interruption per month falls within our SLA.
The service was unavailable for a maximum of 20 min, this twice, over the last 6 months.

data.Question: Do you communicate major changes to clients in advance (date, nature, unavailability window, etc.)?
data.Commentaire: Any planned service unavailability is communicated 15 days in advance to the client

data.Question: How do you ensure the lifecycle of your administrator accounts (account creation and deletion)?
data.Commentaire:
Creation on demand and according to employee profile, if the need is justified
Deletion upon job change, responsibility change or employee departure

data.Question: What is your internal password policy for administrators (length, complexity, renewal, MFA)?
data.Commentaire: 16 characters minimum and passphrase recommendation, 3 different character types, no renewal and mandatory MFA

data.Question: What is your internal password policy for technical accounts (length, complexity, renewal)?
data.Commentaire: Same as administrators

data.Question: Do you conduct periodic account and rights reviews on sensitive components? At what frequency?
data.Commentaire: Every 6 months minimum

data.Question: Is your service compatible with open standard protocols: SAML, OpenID Connect, OAuth2, to use your clients' SSO?
data.Commentaire: SAMLv2 compatible

data.Question: Does your application/service have local accounts? (not managed by a client SSO, with an account base managed by your service)
data.Commentaire:
Yes, an emergency administrator account that is never used except in force majeure cases and SSO accounts from our directory to guarantee support and integration (temporary at this period) of the application at our clients.
The client can use local accounts, not linked to their SSO, if they wish

data.Question: In the case of local accounts, what is the default password policy?
data.Commentaire: 3 different characters from the 4 known sets (lowercase, uppercase, digit and symbol), prohibition to reuse the last 10 passwords, renewal every 90 days, 10 characters minimum. All these parameters are configurable by the client themselves within the limits of authorized values.

data.Question: In the case of local accounts, are passwords stored in an irreversible form?
data.Commentaire: Yes, hashed and salted before being stored

data.Question: In the case of local accounts, is there two-factor authentication in place for access to administrator accounts or privileged accounts (for application accounts)?
data.Commentaire: Mandatory two-factor authentication for accounts linked to our SSO, for local accounts handled by the client, two-factor authentication possible, possibility to force two-factor authentication on all accounts without SSO.

data.Question: In the case of local accounts, how are accounts managed (creation and deletion)? Is the client responsible for managing their accounts?
data.Commentaire: The client is responsible for local account management

data.Question: Can a third party (service provider or supplier) access our data? If yes, under what conditions?
data.Commentaire: No

data.Question: Under what conditions do governments have access to our data?
data.Commentaire: None except judicial request duly addressed to our company of which the client would be informed

data.Question: What is your procedure for handling data theft?
data.Commentaire: Procedure that follows our incident management process, investigation and characterization of the incident, its scope and affected clients as soon as we are alerted to the incident. Communication to impacted clients within 8h following first notification with the most precise elements possible. Daily communication, if necessary, until end of investigation and resolution of the exploited vulnerability.

data.Question: What is the notification delay in case of proven data theft?
data.Commentaire: 1 day once theft is characterized and confirmed by our company and 3 days to make a complete inventory of stolen or accessed data.

data.Question: What are the modalities of this notification?
data.Commentaire: Email to client contact owned by the support team unless contrary mention and instruction

data.Question: Does your security incident management procedure correspond to a standard? (ISO 27035, ITIL...)
data.Commentaire: No

data.Question: Do you regularly test your security incident response procedures?
data.Commentaire: Once a year

data.Question: What is your vulnerability remediation process?
data.Commentaire: Any critical vulnerability that exposes our clients' data is handled within 48h, other vulnerabilities are handled within 1 month maximum during application version updates

data.Question: What are your commitments in terms of high and critical vulnerability fixes?
At what frequency and by what means do you search for vulnerabilities on your network and applications?
data.Commentaire:
Monthly, static vulnerability scanner plus weekly static source code scan.
Subscription to national CERT vulnerability watch for the most critical vulnerabilities and annual pentest.

data.Question: Can we perform an external vulnerability assessment on the service?
data.Commentaire: A priori no, these tests must be supervised and their impact must be measured by our company before being authorized. These tests cannot take place if the offering subscribed by the client is shared

data.Question: Do you use a malware detection solution (antivirus, EDR), on your non-production information system?
data.Commentaire: No

data.Question: What security measures do you apply on your production environments (e.g. application firewall, database audit, network filtering, EDR, etc.)?
data.Commentaire: Antivirus on servers, whitelist network filtering (port 443 and SSH different from 22) via physical firewall and reverse proxy, IPS fail2ban probes

data.Question: Do you use unencrypted flows (ftp, http, telnet etc.), internally or for data exchanges with your clients?
data.Commentaire: Internally, some flows, protected by firewall, reverse proxy and WAF are unencrypted, these flows are not exposed on the internet

data.Question: Is your service protected by a WAF? If yes, which one?
data.Commentaire: Yes

data.Question: Are you protected against DDoS? If yes how?
data.Commentaire: DDoS protection from the hosting provider

data.Question:
How do you separate our data from that of other clients? How is separation achieved? (different servers? 1 client = 1 database? Or data is encrypted with a different key per client?, ...)
If an attacker finds a vulnerability in the application (using a client's instance), what mechanisms prevent them from having access to all client data?
data.Commentaire:
For a shared offering, resources (DB, RAM etc.) are shared so data is stored in the same place, a dedicated key mechanism per client allows data segmentation and guarantees that client A does not see client B's data on the same shared instance, mechanism proven each year by pentest and no vulnerability revealed so far.
For a dedicated offering, logical resources are dedicated, use different encryption keys that guarantee total isolation between client tenants.

data.Question: Are your production platforms isolated from the rest of your information system? By what means?
data.Commentaire: Yes, different machines

data.Question: Do you use production data to feed non-production platforms (pre-prod, ...)?
data.Commentaire: No

data.Question: What means do you implement to protect your source codes?
data.Commentaire: Source code is not freely accessible on the internet and its modification access is controlled, source code modifications are subject to validations involving at least 2 different people.

data.Question: Do you follow OWASP (or similar) guidelines for application development? Have your developers received training?
data.Commentaire: Yes and Yes

data.Question: Do you have an acceptance testing program for the application code you develop and deploy?
data.Commentaire: Yes, both in terms of source code quality and source code security

data.Question: What third-party applications and services do you use as part of your service?
data.Commentaire: Statistical analysis solution (on-prem) for platform analysis, customer support solution, service health monitoring solution

data.Question: How do you secure your development environments?
data.Commentaire: Like a production environment on configuration and behind a VPN for connection outside premises then a bastion for its administration access.

data.Question: Do you outsource part of your developments?
data.Commentaire: Connectors (different project and without adherence with other application modules) can be outsourced but are rigorously controlled by one or more people internally before their production deployment.

data.Question: Is there restricted and monitored access to critical assets 24x7?
data.Commentaire: Yes, under the responsibility of the hosting provider

data.Question: If dedicated infrastructure is needed, is it isolated?
data.Commentaire: No, not physically

data.Question: Do you perform checks on all personnel with physical access to platforms? What is their scope?
data.Commentaire: Population restricted to 3 people at our company, these accesses are almost never used.

data.Question: What are your protections against external environmental threats?
data.Commentaire: ISO27001 certification of the hosting provider to attest to the handling of this risk

data.Question: Do you trace employee access to client data?
data.Commentaire: Yes, each connection to the platform and consultation of a client environment is traced, accessible to the client whether for connections of their personnel or our company's personnel

data.Question: Does your service allow tracing user connections and actions? Does the client have access to these logs?
data.Commentaire: Yes, connections and modification/deletion actions are mandatorily traced, traces viewable by client pilots (= privileged profiles)

data.Question: How long do you keep logs?
data.Commentaire: Technical logs (not visible to client) are kept 90 days; functional logs (visible to client) are kept 36 months or contract duration (whichever is shorter)

data.Question: How do you perform backups of our data and what commitment do you make (RTO, RPO)?
data.Commentaire:
Daily complete backup, encrypted then externalized.
RTO 8h
RPO 24h

data.Question: Have you implemented an immutable backup system?
data.Commentaire: No

data.Question: Have you established a DRP and BCP?
data.Commentaire: Yes

data.Question: Is the DRP/BCP tested periodically?
data.Commentaire: Yes every quarter

data.Question: Where is data stored in our case (location)?
data.Commentaire: France

data.Question: Are your data centers GDPR compliant?
data.Commentaire: Yes

data.Question: Are you ISAE3402/SSAE16 compliant?
data.Commentaire: No

data.Question: Are you ISO-27001 compliant? On what scope?
data.Commentaire: In progress, for July 2024, on the following scope: "Development and operational and security maintenance of a GRC platform"

data.Question: Do you have documentation for potential auditors?
data.Commentaire: Yes
